title: Part A
stimulusHtml: 1 point is earned for: stating that the marginal benefit is $1.
descriptions:

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for: correctly calculating the total consumer surplus from consuming 5 units of X.

CS = ($16 −$4) + ($12−$4) + ($8−$4) + ($4−$4) + ($1−$4)= $21
OR
CS=$41−$20 = $21
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for: correctly calculating the total consumer surplus from consuming 5 units of X.

CS = ($16 −$4) + ($12−$4) + ($8−$4) + ($4−$4) + ($1−$4)= $21
OR
CS=$41−$20 = $21

The student response earns all of the following points:

1 point is earned for: correctly calculating the total consumer surplus from consuming 5 units of X.

CS = ($16 −$4) + ($12−$4) + ($8−$4) + ($4−$4) + ($1−$4)= $21
OR
CS=$41−$20 = $21

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for: explaining that this combination of X and Y is not optimal because the marginal benefit per dollar of good X (MBx/Px=$4/$4 =1) is less than the marginal benefit per dollar of good Y (MBy/Py=$8/$2=4). (This can also be stated as MBx/MBy < Px/Py.)

(MBx/Px = 1) is not equal to (MBy/Py = 4) is acceptable.

MBx/Px is less than MBy/Py is acceptable.

MBy/Py is greater than MBx/Px is acceptable.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: 1 point is earned for: stating that Martha’s optimal combination is 3 units of X and 4 units of Y.
